laboratory_examinations.findings: Increased during a hypertensive attack as well as in a 24-h collection; subsequently dropped to the normal range postoperatively, then elevated again at age 42, consistent with recurrent PGL., ultimately normalized after corporectomy of lumbar vertebra 2.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially elevated during hypertensive attacks, normalized post-operatively, elevated again at age 42, normalized after lumbar surgery.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Revealed increased uptake in the proximal right femur and in the frontal skull.
Normalized after corporectomy of lumbar vertebra 2.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Remained normal after surgery for lumbar vertebra.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Dropping to the normal range after the removal of extraadrenal PGL.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: 24-h urinary excretion of norepinephrine, epinephrine, and dopamine
laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal in patient II.6 and III.3.
